Reviews.Title: “Great Experience...Ulonda Saved The Day!!”
Reviews.Author: Patti M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed numerous times here and the accomodations are great. The hotel overall is very clean...rooms, pool area, restaurant, etc. and the staff is very friendly. We just stayed 3 days for Labor Day 2012 weekend. We left early and upon unpacking at home had realized I had left my jewelry that I had taken in the safe that was in our room. I called the front desk and spoke to Ulonda and she went right to our room and retrieved my jewelry. Then she hand carried it herself to the mailing center and made sure it was shipped out to me. She then called me to tell me it had been shipped. I received it the very next day and I will be forever grateful to her for her loyal help. She was wonderful. She knew I was upset and kept telling me it will be okay and it will get to me. Thanks so much Ulonda!! We will see you again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Yes”
Reviews.Author: rgriffi
Reviews.Content: Will stay next year enjoy the bar; the food the room and it right on the beach you dont have to go far to have fun and the parking is good and i almost forgot the pool area there is not muck i can say

Reviews.Title: “Good For the price”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler52787
Reviews.Content: This was a clean and affordable hotel located relatively close to the beach. It was about 3 blocks walk to the beach and is at the very end of the OC bus route. (You can ride the bus to the boardwalk and other attractions.) It was a good value, especially if you booked online and received the free passes to the local water park. The staff was friendly and helpful; however, don't try to use the ice machine to fill a cooler (they get really upset about that). The pool was clean and there were a few shops and things within walking distance. The restaurant wasn't great but wasn't terrible. All in all it was a decent place for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: cbinkley
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel,can't wait to go back. Staff was helpful, right next to the beach and good crab shacks. Tiki bar and pool were nice and clean. The cafe was good. The only thing that isn't great is the 30 min distance from the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “One of the cheapest and One of the best hotels!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer in late June and me and my family really enjoyed it. Rates were very cheap in June. This is a great family hotel for families that dont have Thousands to spend on a vacation. Room size was plenty for a family of 4. Has a great reasurant in the hotel (Seasonal) with a pool-side bar which my husband really loved! Staff was very polite and acomodating to whatever we needed. Rooms were well stocked, Nice and clean kitchen. Only thing I didn't care for which was at no fault to hotel is that it's so far from pretty much everything, I mean we have young kids so they want the boardwalk, Jolly Rogers and all of the other kid things, but the beach is very close which made our travel with 2 kids very nice. Were already booked for our next stay at Econo lodge next month in mid August 2012. Overall really enjoyed our 5 day stay at Econo lodge and would recommend to anyone willing to drive alittle ways to get to the board walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place...great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jjbaltimore
Reviews.Content: Econo Lodge is clean and pretty modern, nice kitchenette and right near the beach! The restaurant was very very good for breakfast and lunch too! Nice pool too, not huge, but clean and appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in OC”
Reviews.Author: PhilaDad37
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well maintained. Good location... The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Will return in th future and reccomend to others. If the boardwalk is your thing it may be to far away but the beach is a 1 block walk.

Reviews.Title: “A new experience”
Reviews.Author: redcatcec
Reviews.Content: The room was clean right down to the shower head, this was a really nice place to stay. The staff was courteous and helpful, although a little loud at the front desk-they had too much griping going on that no one needed to hear, their voices neded to be generally lowered. Some people would say "use your indoor voice". We liked it there, there was no noise coming from the neighboring rooms, walls were plenty thick or insulated. The air conditioning was ok, not too loud. My only observation was the fact that I parked too close to where the balconies are, people tend to throw stuff off them-like cigarettes, and they land on the cars below.

Reviews.Title: “Better than before”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and had decided we would not return again. However, we had to make a one night trip to the area recently and only needed a place to rest our heads. This hotel was the most inexpensive I could find, so we decided to give it a second chance. I'm glad we did. The room was much cleaner than before and had new carpet, bedding, drapes. The bathroom also appeared to be cleaner. The kitchen area also was cleaner. We did not find any bugs in the room, unlike our last experience. The staff at the front desk were mature and courteous. I asked if the hotel was under new management and was told that it was the same management as before. Hopefully management will retain the mature and professional staff when the summer season begins. I'm always willing to give a place a second chance and this time I am glad that I did. The EconoLodge is not a luxury hotel by any means, but it is sufficient for a family vacation with a location close to the beach, shopping, and dining, without being in the hubbub of Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Early Off-Season Vacation done PERFECLY!”
Reviews.Author: taprice
Reviews.Content: This Hotel forgot NOTHING. Full little kitchen, perfectly clean room with all the necessities, heated pool... but its the PEOPLE that truely make this the perfect pick! From on the phone booking, the front desk, the room attendants.... They are all kind, happy, and genuine friendly people. there is nothing they would have done to see our party happy for the week!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: mrmisrule
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay here. Room was very clean, kitchen area spotless. Our room had a "city view" which was a view of the condos across the street, but from our balcony we could glimpse a view of the ocean. Easy walk to the beach. We visited in the off-season, but our rate was half of what other hotels were asking. There are some plastic dishes, glasses and a few pans provided. Dishwashing soap and dish towels also provided. Fridge is full-size so plenty of room. Easy check in/check out. Free parking and luggage racks provided which made it easy to get our stuff to our third floor room. Loved walking on the uncrowded beach every morning and evening. This hotel maybe too far from the boardwalk for some visitors, but while visiting in the off season, with no bumper to bumper traffic or for families with children who want to spend their time at the beach, this would be a good spot. I saw a bus advertised that travels the busy road starting in May that advertised a ride all day for $1.00. There is a bus lane and with hard to find parking near the boardwalk, this hotel may be a good option for those who want to get down to the boardwalk/Inlet area for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: watsonsontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. We didn't know it was Bikers Weekend and so the hotel was full. But there were no problems at all. The staff were helpful and friendly. The cleaning lady was lovely. Good location, just a block from the beach and within a block there are good restaurants, bars, cinema, mini golf and a laundramat. We had a first floor room with a patio on to the pool which had a nice poolside bar. Our room was large with a well equipped kitchen. and comfortable beds. I would happily stay here again in OC

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hmorgan13
Reviews.Content: When we booked a week at the Econo Lodge in March, little did we know it would collide with Hurricane Irene. The staff at the motel, especially Marsha and Kelly were so accommodating, so friendly, and so competent, that we only missed one day due to weather. The room was large and immaculate. It had a well-stocked kitchenette, a modern bathroom, and a great flat screen TV. The location is great. We hope to be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite stay in Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: H2Vacations
Reviews.Content: Really nice place and GREAT front desk staff!!! Very close to the beach and a GREAT PRICE for families on a budget. Will stay on our next trip to OC. Close to great food and a mini golf right across the street. Room size is nice, as we had 5 on our trip and it worked out nice. Cleaning staff was honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Canomom
Reviews.Content: Our family was hesitant regarding the Econo Lodge as our family had a previous experience with this hotel brand in another city. However, the price was right and the location was perfect. The hotel was clean and the staff polite and professional. The room was a good size, 2 double beds and pullout sofa, with a table and 4 chairs for eating meals. Lots of elbow room for everyone. Kitchen area served our purposes. Minimal dishware, but what was there worked for us. We loved the location, next door to Delaware and a short walk to the ocean. Pool was great, restaurant we never ate at, but we heard was good from other hotel guests. Pool was very busy everyday with lots of families. The balconies were a good size too. Lots of parking - undercover or open lot depending on the size of your vehicle. We will bring our aerobed next year though. Mattress on sofabed was not too good. We will book here again next year! The first place we have found in Ocean City that is reasonably priced and clean that we will return to!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't stay here yet....but GREAT customer service...I will re-book”
Reviews.Author: tiki1171
Reviews.Content: I had a trip scheduled for the weekend of August 27th....the same weekend that Hurricane Irene is supposed to hit the east coast. Well, I was pretty upset because I looked on the website and saw that I had already missed the cancellation deadline. Lo and behold, this morning, I have a message on voice mail from Kelly at the EconoLodge stating that Ocean City is in the process of being evacuated and that she was going to refund my credit card. I was completely astonished; she had called every single person that had a reservation for this weekend and said the same to them. That is excellent customer service; I know they are losing a ton of $$. This location will definitely get my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Probably would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Ginger B
Reviews.Content: The room was big: 2 double beds, a pull-out sofa, table and chairs, patio, kitchenette, and bathroom. We stayed on the first floor facing the pool, which didn't allow for much privacy, although since we stayed in the last room, we had slightly more privacy than any other first-floor pool-side room. The room was clean, but the stairwells (outdoor) continuously had cigarette butts and gum on them (as if they didn't regularly upkeep them). Being ocean side made for a short walk to the beach. The Rio Grande Cafe and TIki Bar had good food and drinks and was usually open pretty late if it didn't rain. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: SandyClymer_PA
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Fully-equipped kitchen was great especially with a family on a limited budget. We were able to save money on eating-out which allowed us to enjoy other activities. Rates were reasonable. Restaurant was reasonably priced and food was good. Tiki bar had an upbeat environment and good entertainment. No complaints at all during our 3-night stay. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: SydsMommie
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to visit OC at the last minute. We were on a budget and lucked out getting Oceanblock for $150 a night. We were greeted by friendly front desk staff who were kind enough to let us check in early. The hotel which listed as "Newly Remodeled" still looked a little dated. Our room had a nice and clean kitchenette with a full oven (only one rack) and plenty of dishs. Our family of six (two adults, three tweens and a toddler) had enough room to move around. The "heated" pool was a clean and we have plenty of chairs. A drawback is you have to walk through the tiki bar to get to the pool. As a parent, I wasn't too thrilled with my kid seeing the rowdy, drunk vacationers. Another drawback was the housekeeping. She didn't sweep the pile of sand that was in the bathroom nor did she make one of the beds because a "personal" item (kids necklace) was left on the bed. The beach is right out the door and you can see it from most rooms. It's also on the line of Fenwick Island, DE and about a 30 minute bus ride from the boardwalk. We'd stay again if we can't find something closer to the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it's a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: KCashVa
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 (mom, dad, teenage son) and one extra teenager stayed here for 5 nights in August 2010. Check in was super fast and they let us check in about an hour early. We got a pool view room as requested. The room, bathroom and kitchenette were all very clean. They need to purchase new bedspreads. The fold out couch had a large stain and the mattress was severly worn...but still usable. The kitchenette had sink, fridge with freezer, oven and 4 burner stove, small microwave, plastic dishes, tiny plastic coffee cups, real glasses, and a few forks, knives and spoons and a full size coffee maker. Coffee and filters are provided as well. Bathroom was well stocked with towels and toiletries. Balcony has two plastic chairs, but no table. There is a dining table with 4 chairs in the room as well. Old style TV with remote. A/C works great. Shower goes from hot to cold with no warning, so be careful with kids. The pool was pretty clean, but lots of people seemed to use it as a place to rinse off after the beach, even though an outdoor shower is provided. Annoying! The pool deck has plenty of tables, chairs and lounge chairs. The pool bar was really a nice feature as well as the attached cafe. The food is above average and well priced. Service staff is excellent. The walk to the beach is very easy. Parking was never a problem. I would love to see the rooms spruced up a little...but for the price we paid, it was a good value. I would stay here again and would suggest it to friends looking for a clean hotel at a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BetaGirl425
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good hotel if you're the kind of people that spend most of the time out on the beach or wandering through Ocean City. It's a hotel that gets the job done - a place to sleep, clean up after a day at the beach, get something to eat. There is a balcony that has partical veiw to the beach. I not going to lie but there is traffic noise, but my dad and I find it very relaxing to sit there and watch the cars go by, like you are watching time go by. It's a resonable price and very close to the beach, mini golf, and restaurants. The air condition is cranked so reasonable to bring a sweatshirt. My family will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT THE ECONO-LODGE”
Reviews.Author: drummer74_10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Econolodge in Ocean City Maryland, and I must say, we enjoyed the hotel and the nearby dining and amusements very much. The poolside bar and outside dining was great, a cold drink and some snacks after a day at the beach ! There was plenty of parking, a short walk to the beach, and the room was comfortable and practical. We used the in room safe, and the cost is taken off the bill when you check out....just ask. Already looking forward to next years trip.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: TheWalkinDudeJCS
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel through kayak and was somewhat pleased as I had stayed in this hotel about 10 years ago and had an awesome experience. sadly the only upgrade in those ten years has been to paint the outside turquoise. When checking into our room we found what appeared to be body hair on top of a comforter and corn chips on the other bed and on the balcony deck. the room also had a slight feet and mold smell. as my buddy and i are used to when paying cheap prices we just stripped the comforter and went about our way. the sliding door was broken and the desk ignored our request to fix it. it was probably for the best as the room got way too hot at night and we had to open the door all night. we attempted to run the ac unit but the mold and mildew clearly gave us allergy symptoms. as it was difficult to sleep between the temp changes, moldy air and one pillow on my bed we decided to leave a day early and i checked into the zyrtec suite at home that evening. another disturbing thing was we noted several of the housekeeping staff on break in a guest room that appeared to have people checked into it. there were suitcases about and the maids were sitting on the beds laughing. also note the heated pool was 65 degrees

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: DBee54
Reviews.Content: We were in OC for some business my husband had and we hadn't made reservations so the vacant sign was on at the Econo and we stopped in and got a room. The place was an "OK". We left the slider door open to get fresh air, however, the traffic noise was horrible. The room was out dated and some items showed wear and tear. The balcony had some rusted furniture. No continental breakfast. However, they had restaraunt was just down the hall, which was very convenient. Good food, prices and service. It was good that we only stayed one night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building but the maids are thieves”
Reviews.Author: AuntGetgo
Reviews.Content: After 20 plus years of staying at the Econolodge on 145th street our family had 2 rooms on the 8th floor. (not attached) We have had family stay there a couple times a year. One room had $50 stolen from a purse and the other room had an expensive prescription drug stolen. When we spoke to the motel general manager (Buddy Post) he refused to even acknowledge that it was a possibility or take any responsibility. He hung up on a phone call about what happened. He's known our family for nearly his entire life and we do not have a reputation for filing malicious reports. He would not even return a phone call until he was informed the next phone call would be to corporate. So after 20 plus years of having family and friends stay at the Econolodge I am very sad to say "Stay away. Your items will be riffled through and things will be missing." This Econolodge is owned by Purnell Properties Inc.

Reviews.Title: “Econo Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: beachyboy76
Reviews.Content: Econo Lodge of Ocean City exceeded my expectations. We enjoyed a clean room with stove, microwave, fridge/freezer, coffee pot, and even silverware, cups and plates! The staff was helpful and friendly. The appearance cannot match that of fancy hotels like Dunes Manor, but this is, after all an Econo Lodge. This hotel is terrific for those on a budget who still like to have acceptable quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased !”
Reviews.Author: Maria N
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it offered all the amenities I wanted for our trip at a great price. When we arrived, the front desk staff were welcoming and efficient. We even got to check in a little early! The room was fine for two occupants. Having a kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator and coffeemaker was a bonus. The only thing I found lacking was the size of the coffee cups; they were tiny. The bath was clean, large and brightly lite. Wasn't thrilled with the bedspread design, and the mattress and pillows bothered my back and neck somewhat (although my daughter didn't complain), but at least it wasn't that fake bamboo furniture from the '60s! If you want music, might want to bring it with you. The living area was adequate. I could see the ocean from the sofa, and having a small dining table and chairs worked well for us. Looking to the right from our side-facing balcony, I could see the ocean and enjoy the sunrises. Looking to the left, I could see the bay, sunsets and the Fenwick Lighthouse! The only downside I noted from a side-facing balcony was that breezes were hard to come by. The heated outdoor pool was clean and enjoyable. We had a few meals from the on-site restaurant, and found them to be of good quality and taste. Our nine-night stay was very relaxing. I would recommend this hotel to others without hesitation, and will stay there on future trips to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Good family location”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this EconoLodge Tuesday through Friday, 10/7 - 10/10. I must say that the beds here (two doubles) were among the most comfortable I've ever found in a hotel. There is also a sleep sofa in the room, with a divider between the beds and the sleep sofa. For families, the kitchen area would be a great money-saving option instead of eating out all the time. The staff were quite friendly. The beach is a just a short walk away. The location at the north end of Ocean City is perfect if you don't want to be in the midst of all the activity in town. Restaurants, gift shops, candy stores, and minigolfs are all within walking distance. A major problem with this hotel is housekeeping. Our room smelled like rotten fruit and was infested with fruit flies. I thought that after a day or so that the flies would die off. I was wrong, they kept increasing in number. Finally I began searching and eventually I found a totally rotted, never-been-peeled banana under one of the beds (and a capsule of medicine or vitamin under the other, as well as candy wrappers and used tissues). The staff offered to switch our room, but I figured since I'd found the source of the problem, we would just stay put. (I really didn't feel like packing up everything to move to another room. In retrospect, I wish that I had.) On the morning we checked out, there were still a good two dozen fruit flies in the bathroom (significantly down from the original number). There were other issues with housekeeping also. Beds were never made correctly. To my disappointment, fitted bottom sheets are not used by this hotel. Top sheets to the floor on one side and barely covering the top of the bed on the other is just wrong. I had to remake the beds every day. And they never bothered to put the bedspreads back on the beds. We often saw the housekeeping staff watching TV in the rooms where they were supposedly working, sometimes several of them at the same time. There were spots in the hallway that needed to be vacuumed when we got there, these spots were still dirty when we left. We had to go begging for shampoo one day when none was left for us. And we had a housekeeper burst in the room on us once in spite of the "Do not disturb" sign. If management would properly train their housekeeping staff, I would be able to give this hotel a much higher rating. Unlike most hotels, there were no feedback forms available in the room. My primary comment would have addressed the problems with housekeeping. The only other negative was the shower. First of all, the shower head is one of the worst I have ever used. Second, the surging between scalding hot water and freezing cold is not only annoying, it could be dangerous. This is something that should be fixed. We did not have opportunity to use the pool or the eat at the restaurant, so I cannot comment on these amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Oceanblock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baltobchgrl
Reviews.Content: A great location to beach and restaurants. It's not posh but was clean enough for us picky girls. Staff was great, parking was no problem on street. I would suggest staying on second or third floor if you have a pool side room. First floor rooms open directly to the pool (quite a show when you open your curtains!) Didn't visit the pool, bar, or restaurant. We got an excellent rate when we called the hotel directly since business was slow. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsMck
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Econo Lodge in Ocean City. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located just a half block from the beach. It has a nice outdoor pool with a restaurant/bar. My only complaint has to do with the housekeeping. When we arrived in the afternoon, we found that our room had garbage in the trash can and one of the beds did not have any sheets. Two days later, housekeeping failed to come by to clean our room. I notified the front desk of this but, unfortunately, housekeeping departs at 2:30 pm and there was nothing they could do about it. Not a big deal, I took some sheets and pillowcases and made up the room myself. But still, given these problems, I can't give this hotel more than a three star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT stay - will definetly go back......”
Reviews.Author: cranburytravel
Reviews.Content: We were in Ocean City last week...... we first rented a place on 10th ave and realized it was senior week - (word of advise - do not go to OC on senior week) So we checked out other hotels and found the Econo Lodge.... I wish we found this place sooner.... it was GREAT - The staff was soooo friendly - rooms were clean - pool was so nice - very short walk to the beaches which were also amazing. They had a tiki bar which was nice to go have a drink - across the street is miniture golf.... Only problem we had is we were only staying one night - :o( My husband and I wish we found this place first - but will be going back here the end of the summer to stay - great place - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: bonnieww
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here the weekend of April 12th. We had never stayed here before but someone we know recommended it. The price was really reasonable. It was great for the price we pd. A combo room that could be divided off between bedroom are & sitting area with a folding room divider. Like having the kitchen are and also the sitting area which included a couch. Nice private balcony with a glimpse of the ocean. Room was well kept as were the indoor corriders. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed, We Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: sgurl_23
Reviews.Content: On Aug 18 we arrived around 12:30 at night and went to the front desk, the gentleman was extremely helpful and it was a fast check in. We got to our room where there was a full kichenette a sofa and a nice sized table and chairs. It was extremely clean and spacious, i mean really clean. The bathroom was beautiful i was so impressed. The sing in the bathroom made you feel like you were in luxury, i have never seen a model like that in a hotel before. We went out to our balcony where belowe us was the pool and the tiki bar, alot of people that evening, i do believe there was a lacrosse team staying the same time we were. It was nice though. The next morning when we got up we ate breakfast in the Rio Grande Cafe on premesis the food was amazing and they give you so much. I had there fruite bowl because of dieting and it was so amazing. the beach is not even 1/2 a block it seemed so much closer and beautiful. the food and drinks at the rio grande tiki bar and cafe were very well priced not expensive at all. the service was amazing and omg how friendly everyone is. I loved our stay at the econo lodge and i reccomend this to any one and everyone for your stay at ocean city. Theres also so much to do right around the hotel mini golf across the street, dippin dots down the street walking distance. Pretzel time ect. its a wonderful place and the Hotel was beyond my expectations. Econo lodge staff thank you so much for making our stay a memorable one. To the head waitress at the cafe we love your service, my dad would go down everymorning during our 3 day stay get coffe and u remembered his order the last time we had breakfast there. THank you all again.

Reviews.Title: “good clean place”
Reviews.Author: bubbles1974
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Econolodge alot. The rooms were very clean, the pool was clean and was an excellent distance from the beach. The front desk staff was very helpful and very cordial. THe smell that everyone has spoken of is their cleaning solution and is strong initially however after about 5 minutes with the door open it disapates. This was well worth the money and I would recommend it to anyone. I would stay here if I was to return to OC however the general area is dirty and needs much sprucing.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and love it. The service is wonderful and the rooms are very clean and spacious. We love having lunch or breakfast out by the pool and the wait staff is great. we are coming back this year and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This year we stayed at a downtown hotel, however last year (2004) we stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to the Delaware state line. When we checked in the front office area was clean, but the room we had was very dirty. The staff seemed nice and took care of the issues we had, however the inconveinance of it all made us choose another hotel for this past year. I would not recommend this hotel unless your fine with not so clean accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Econo Lodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending mega-bucks staying on the boardwalk with sub-standard conditions, this hotel was a treat. The staff is very friendly. Rooms are clean and neat. Patio over-looked the pool. They have a wonderful coffee house with great breakfasts and lunches. And its just a short walk to the beach. No ocean views though.The location is wonderful! There are lots of things within walking distance of the hotel. Its right beside Nicks Ribs! A minature golf place on the other side and two more across the street, in addition to Fishers popcorn and Candy Kitchen. Two blocks from a movie theater and three blocks from Phillips Crabhouse. Its also two blocks from the bus that runs the whole way up to the boardwalk (even though thats about an hour ride).The only bad thing we could see was the after-check-out shower, which was basically a hose-type thing with cold water in the middle of the parking lot. So you might want to keep that in mind.But we would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Oceanblock
HotelInfo.Address: 145th St. & Coastal Hwy., Ocean City, MD 21842
